Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, Great Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian_bol
Reviews.Content: It is a perfect place to stay in Sultanahmet. We had a great experience and the hotel exceeded our expectations. It is a family run hotel, with excellent people to look after you all time. It was my 4th time in Istanbul and I would definitely book this hotel next time I go back.

Reviews.Title: “good location, great rooms, perfect service!”
Reviews.Author: ascetic_sg
Reviews.Content: This hotel completely exceeded all our expectations. The room is very clean and comfortable. We had the best shower in this hotel throughout our 2week trip around Turkey! Breakfast spread was decent, but make sure you go early before it runs out. What made this hotel stand out was the staff coupled with its new facilities. Staff (especially Suat!) was always very welcoming and charming. Suat even walked us all the way to Hagia Sofia Musuem about 10 mins away so that we could link up with our tour guide. The staff also shared with us practical advise on how to protect ourselves as tourists. Also, we were offered tea everytime they saw us! We would usually spend 10 minutes in the lobby after a long day just catching up and chatting with the friendly staff! The staff was also very responsive. Internet was down for a short while, but was fixed in a jiffy after we informed the reception. The location is great! 10 mins walk to the historic areas in the "Old City" or Grand Bazaar. We had to stay in another hotel on the last night of our Istanbul trip as it was arranged by the airlines that rescheduled our flight. However, this other hotel pales in comparison to Cesme Hotel. Cesme's staff exhibited a 5-star service, making it the best hotel we stayed at in Turkey. We will be staying here again the next time we are in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel Experience in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jennifer b
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 6 nights at the Cesme Hotel and had a wonderful experience. What struck us immediately about the hotel upon arrival was its clean, modern design and the hospitality of the staff. Located in the heart of the old city, the Cesme is an ideal place to come back to at the end of a long day of walking around Istanbul and visiting the sights. The hotel is a new construction so the rooms are very comfortable and clean, with great bathrooms. Each room has a mini-bar, where you can keep your own food and snacks, as well as free Internet, personalized climate control, satellite television, and a hot water heater for the coffee and tea, which are complimentary. The breakfast in the morning, served on one of their terraces, is great--breads, cakes, cheese, eggs, meat, cereal, fruit, tomatoes, cucumbers, jams and honey. The hotel also has a rooftop terrace with comfortable lounge furniture and breathtaking views over the old city and onto the Marmara Sea. What we also appreciated at the hotel was its incredibly helpful and welcoming staff. Whether taking us personally to a recommended restaurant or helping us carry purchases to the rooms or offering us tea upon our return each evening, the staff couldn't have been more attentive. If I were to return to Istanbul, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good price/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: alikus
Reviews.Content: Located in the very heart of Old City, 5 mins to main attractions, beautiful view over the Bosphorus from the breakfast terrace. Clean, in very good condition. Breakfast mediocre and there is almost nothing left at 9 (start of it is at 8 ;). But hey - for the price we paid (135 EUR for 3 nights) it's a super bargain. :) Hopefully you neighbours won't be loud, though, because once can hear people talking in other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: froso p
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in the most beautiful area of Istanbul! Very clean , very quiet and very polite staff. Simple but decent breakfast. Five minutes walk from Blue Mosque and Ayasofya, ten minutes from Topkapi palace and twenty minutes from Capali Carci. Excellent heating free wi fi and safe box in the room. We thank you and hope to see you soon again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ana29
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is just perfect, only about 5 minutes away from a square on which the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sofia face each other. Lovely small streets in the hotel neighbourhood are packed with other small hotels. There are no many cafes and restaurants in the vicinity tough, but you can find some very small shops nearby in case you need something urgently. We had a triple room, which was of a decent size, nicely furnished, equipped with a mini-bar, safe, kettle, cups and coffee and tea-bags. We also got slippers, the towels were changed every morning. The bathroom was brand new and perfectly clean. The TV was tiny, with not so many interesting programmes. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The breakfast is served at a small terrace, which is in winter covered only with nylon sheets (so, no closed windows). The terrace is heated, but if it is very cold outside, windy and rainy, it may be cold and inconvinient to have breakfast without your coat on. The main hotel terrace is on the top of the hotel, above the breakfast area. This terrace has a magnificent view onto the city, it is large and we used to enjoy our coffee up there after the breakfast. The breakfast was OK. They served a variety of dried fruit, fresh apples, oranges and bananas, cheese, olives, only one type of ham (no pork), baked potatoes, meat pie, some corn flakes and butter and jam. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. We had an early flight, and they prepared a room for us for an early check-in. We booked the room for 4 nights, so we qualified for free transport from the airport, which we had prearranged by e-mail before we arrived. On our departure, we tried to arrange the transfer organized by the hotel and the younger receptionist wanted to charge us â‚¬ 30 (this was the one mentioned by another reviewer, I believe), whereas another receptionist told us that the price of the transport organized by the hotel was â‚¬ 25, but he also advised us that it was much cheaper to take usual taxi, what we decided to do after all. But when we started from the hotel on our departure day, he gave us the hotel driver to take us to the airport at the same price as the usual city taxies. I would gladly recommend this hotel to all my friends. It offers excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and convenient rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sini1986
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean. The location could not be better since everything was so close. The service was excellent. We have traveled a lot in Europe and I don't remember any other hotel that has had this kind of atmosphere and friendliness. So thanks to great staff. The only negative thing was the view from the room, but we didn't go to Istanbul for sit in the hotel and watch the view through the window, so it did not bother us. After all the room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for swat and varol”
Reviews.Author: LeahYork
Reviews.Content: Excellent and very helpful staff. Location of the Hotel is great with the the Blue Mosque within 5 mins walking Distance. View on the balcony is breathtaking! the only thing that it is down the hill and if you are old or with kids it is a little bit hard for them .

Reviews.Title: “Luda”
Reviews.Author: ludabg
Reviews.Content: Great location few minutes walk from all the major attractions, reasonable price, clean and modern, but most of all great staff: warm and hospitable. We arrived at 8 am from overnight bus ride from Saloniki, they let us use a free room for 4 hours to sleep until our room was ready: all free of charge. Great terrace view, would stay there again, would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: balmac
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay/s at the Cesme. We first stayed two nights pre-cruise in room 204, and then one night in 303 post-cruise. We were very happy with both rooms, which were clean, roomy and had all modern facilities incl wi-fi. We had booked on internet from NZ and had excellent communication from the hotel prior to our arrival. We did not notice a particular problem with noise, with the windows closed and the air-con on, we were very comfortable and would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again, it's so well placed to visit all the main sites of Istanbul. If we wanted to get away, we loved the Terrace rooftop (which is actually one level up from the outside breakfast room mentioned in the previous review) and very much enjoyed the Bosphorous views and the view of the neighbouring mosque from there. The staff at the Cesme were very helpful and organised cars for us to the hotel, and to the cruise ship. We also qualified for a car to the airport by staying three nights. Add to all this, a very nice breakfast served by lovely staff. THank you, Cesme!

Reviews.Title: “Some things to be aware of”
Reviews.Author: SergiusT
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is clean, modern and everything is of a high standard - the furniture, the AC, the beds, bathrooms etc. We booked for 4 nights so had to stay. If we hadn't booked in advance we would have moved on somewhere else. There is no lobby - essential if you want to get away from the room for a while. The breakfast terrace does not overlook beautiful Bosphorous views - it overlooks the rooftops of the neighbours with a gap in between which you can get a glimpse of the sea - if you sit at the right table. The breakfasts are substantial with something for everyone though. We were on the 2nd floor 203 and were deafened with the traffic struggling to get up the hill as the hotel is situated at the bottom of a hill. There is only room for one car to pass so there were a lot of rows on the street. We couldn't open the window because it was possible for someone to get in easily. We endured the noise. The hotel is quite small so be prepared and I found the staff rather indifferent if basically polite. For this money you can do better and get the same sort of room further on up the hill where it is quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AllYouCanTake
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasant stay, the rooms are very clean and the terrace offers a wonderful view of the sea, especially at sunset time. Good breakfast and good service as well. I warmly suggest this hotel to groups of friends, families and couples. There is no lift available, but attendandts will help you to transport your luggages to yr room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Istanbul !!! dont book...”
Reviews.Author: jujudublin
Reviews.Content: we had booked 4 nights here in May & only stayed for one. the room was ok but when we had a look round we noticed a very small kitchen & it was very dirty. also the terrace on the web & photos well, there were no chairs on the terrace & also very dirty. we had to book another hotel up the road for the last 3 nights. do not stay here.......

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and welcoming staff, we will definetly be back!”
Reviews.Author: Meriem11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel with my parents and brother and had a confortable stay 5 minutes walk from the hippodrome and the blue mosque. Rooms are clean and confortable, the staff are welcoming and efficient, It's a nice place to stay if you need a quite and nice hotel to rest from the day touring. The transfer service is quite useful and the receptionist kindly arranged for additionnal services. I would definetly recommand this boutique hotel! Good value!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: ridercheryl
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new, clean and charming! Host is a wonderful source of knowledge about Istanbul and so accommodating! Thanks to him we enjoyed great meals and sights . The roof top offers spectacular views of the Bosphorus and the city, can't wait to return! Great value, you can not go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice and convenient stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: bahadirrr
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a night in this wonderful place and rate it as the best-in-class offer. It's a fine value-for-money business. Among many pluses, I can note the location - the hotel is situated just a walk away from Blue Mosque and Agia Sophia. Staff is very customer-oriented and attentive to clients. I recommend this hotel to all kind of travellers - families, friends, young pairs. You won't forget your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: ellenwouda
Reviews.Content: Excellent bed, friendly service. Location is fine. very good vcalue for your money

Reviews.Title: “Newly opened hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hakano
Reviews.Content: Looking from the outside, I would never guess to find such a nice and comfortable rooms with very friendly staff. This hotel has a perfect location. The price was comparatively very good deal with such quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: David-of-san-fran
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recently renovated and its location cannot be beat. 2 min from the blue mosque and hagia sophia. Grand Bazar and Istanbul University is 10 min. away. Very clean and tidy rooms with a view. Free breakfast at the terrace with a view and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for Sultanahmet.”
Reviews.Author: overloadedcoffee
Reviews.Content: My parents and I were looking for a Double + Single room package for myself and them during the off-peak season. Cesme Hotel offered us a 70 euro a night deal for both rooms over a 4 night period. The rooms are comfortable, equipped with TV heaters air-conditioning, wireless internet. Both rooms have at least Queen Sized beds, and breakfast is thrown in every morning from 8-11 am. The hotel is 5 stories and offers a great view of the rest of the hotels and houses in the Sultanahmet area and beyond. Don't expect your own kitchen or lounge like some other hotels in te area, but for a good nights sleep and friendly staff, this is definitely a hotel worth it's value. What's more, the location makes it relatively simple to locate among the maze of streets littered with hotels. One straight road all the way up and you are almost at the Blue Mosque, te beginning of the rest of all the important tourist attractions in the area like the Grand/Spice bazaars and other mosques. Definitely worth checking in to.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff & home atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: sandraHongKong
Reviews.Content: Cesme Hotel is located at Sultanahmet, good location for visiting the Palace, Blue Moseque & Hagia Sophia, as well as for food. The owner there is very friendly and the staff there is helpful. Quite comfortable room with coffee, feeling like home when staying inside. Enjoying breakfast at the roof top is also quite interesting experience.

HotelInfo.Name: Sultanahmet Cesme Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Kucukayasofya Mah., Istanbul, Turkey
